resources.string: Last updated: 29/06/2017 Please read these Terms and Conditions (“Terms”, “Terms and Conditions”) carefully before using the Artikle mobile application the (“Service”) operated by AMES (“us”). Your access to and use of the Service is conditioned on your acceptance of and compliance with these Terms. These Terms apply to all visitors, users and others who access or use the Service. By accessing or using the Service you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you disagree with any part of the terms then you may not access the Service. Content Our Service allows you to view, favourite, share and otherwise make available certain information, text, graphics, images, or other material (“Content”). Links To Other Websites Our Service may contain links to third-party website or services that are not owned or controll by Artikle. Artikle has no control over, and assumes no responsibility for, the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third party websites or services. You further acknowledge and agree that Artikle shall not be responsible or liable, directly or indirectly, for any damage or loss caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with use of or reliance on any such content, goods or services available on or through any such web sites or services. Changes We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to modify or replace these Terms at any time. If a revision is material we will try to provide at least 30 days notice prior to any new terms taking effect. What constitutes a material change will be determined at our sole discretion.

Last updated: 29/06/2017 This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use and disclosure of Personal Information we receive from users of the mobile application. We use your Personal Information only for providing and improving the mobile application. By using the mobile application, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Information Collection and Use While using our mobile application, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you. Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to your name or “Personal Information”).
Links To Other Web Sites Our Service may contain links to third-party web sites or services that are not owned or controlled by Artikle. Artikle has no control over, and assumes no responsibility for, the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third party web sites or services. You further acknowledge and agree that Artikle shall not be responsible or liable, directly or indirectly, for any damage or loss caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with use of or reliance on any such content, goods or services available on or through any such web sites or services. Changes We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to modify or replace these Terms at any time. If a revision is material we will try to provide at least 30 days notice prior to any new terms taking effect. What constitutes a material change will be determined at our sole discretion.

The story of our application came from a realisation that millennials are reading less and don’t have the motivation to read as a hobby or for knowledge apart for when they have to read something important. These days many people are preoccupied with other things that reading novels or articles becomes a hassle. Our aim for the application that we are creating is to get not only millennials but everyone to start reading. Instead of creating long and boring articles with clickbait titles we have decided to make a reading application that draws out different stories and articles cutting it down for a short 5 - 10 minute read so that people are able to read something interesting even when their time is limited. The Logo resembles a picture of book, other than the representation of reading it also at the same time foreshadows our core purpose of improving the public’s intelligence and creating a better society in people through the discipline of reading. Team at United Wifi feels the logo once seen shows that we have lost something of great value however try our best to bring it back for the good of people.

You agree that by clicking “Join Now”, “Join Artikle”, “Sign Up” or similar, registering, accessing or using our services (described below), you are agreeing to enter into a legally binding contract with Artikle (even if you are using our Services on behalf of a company). If you do not agree to this contract (“Contract” or “User Agreement”), do not click “Join Now” (or similar) and do not access or otherwise use any of our Services. When you register and join the Artikle Service, you become a Member. If you have chosen not to register for our Services, you may access certain features as a visitor. We may modify this Contract, our Privacy Policy and our Cookies Policies from time to time. If we make material changes to it, we will provide you notice through our Services, or by other means, to provide you the opportunity to review the changes before they become effective. If you object to any changes, you may close your account. Your continued use of our Services after we publish or send a notice about our changes to these terms means that you are consenting to the updated terms. The Services are not for use by anyone under the age of 13. To use the Services, you agree that: (1) you must be the “Minimum Age” (described below) or older; (2) you will only have one Artikle account (and/or one SlideShare account, if applicable), which must be in your real name; and (3) you are not already restricted by Artikle from using the Services. Members who were below this new Minimum Age when they started using the Services under a previous User Agreement may continue to use them, as they have already reached the new Minimum Age since then or will reach it in the near future. “Minimum Age” means 13 years old. However, if law requires that you must be older in order for Artikle to lawfully provide the Services to you without parental consent (including using of your personal data) then the Minimum Age is such older age. Members are account holders. You agree to: (1) try to choose a strong and secure password; (2) keep your password secure and confidential; (3) not transfer any part of your account (e.g., connections) and (4) follow the law and our list of Dos and Don’ts. You are responsible for anything that happens through your account unless you close it or report misuse.
